lexUnit.name: patter.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: run making a light tapping sound.

sentence.text: High heels pattered across the cloakroom floor and someone pushed at the toilet door .
` I 'm a ballet dancer , " she said , and they laughed as she pattered across the floor on her tip-toes .
When Gloria came , pattering across the ward in all her best , Dot could n't bear to see her pretty face and turned away on the pillow with shut eyes .
When eventually she left the sitting-room to go to bed , she pattered into the hall , knowing in advance that she was in for another wretched night of it .
A white waterfall of plaster burst down from the ceiling and slapped and pattered all over him .

With little enthusiasm for the day , Fabia got out of bed and , mulling over her problems and the fact that anywhere she went from now on would have to be on foot , she pattered to the bathroom to take a shower .
` Well , " Melissa murmured aloud as she listened to his footsteps pattering through the hall , followed by the slam of the outer door , ` there goes a man with a guilty secret .
Even Pedro , pattering nervily about the room , seemed more restless than usual , and when he slept his dreams were troubled .
Ringed plovers pattered at the water 's edge of a muddy creek and a whimbrel whistled as it flew overhead .
Stuart jumped out and pattered plumply round to Gillian 's door .
The little boy pattered along beside me , looking up and smiling .
There we watched the rout of the dive-bombers , but the shrapnel pattered down again , and we drew back into the doorway .
She gazed upwards at the newly painted ceiling for a little while , too contented to stir , then with a sudden movement she threw back the covers and pattered over to the window .
There was not a sound from Lily 's room until eleven when the bedroom door banged open and Lily pattered down the stairs .
